title: copperplate script - pre digital?
content:
I looked at Bowfin’s website (very helpful I might add) but cannot locate this font. Pre-digital?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [magic.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604065316/http:/typophile.com/files/magic.jpg) | 18.7 KB |
author: evan

comments.content:
Sterling Script - similar - http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/sterling-script/  
(Sterling Script has alternates too)

Gracia Series 40 - similar - [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/astype/gracia-series-40/](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604065316/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/astype/gracia-series-40/)
Similar yes, but those look like so many other scripts. The Caps are unique on this sample

The bouncing baseline (the i is raised) suggests this was either rub-down lettering or manually set display phototype. A quick check against the more popular Filmotype film fonts doesn’t find a match. Certainly looks pre-digital.

Any specific info on where this came from (North America or elsewhere) and how old it might be?
